result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently being served at the time of revocation.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

Letter with Payment Plan sent to Waupaca County Jail for completion

Case called @ 11:57 a.m. Defendant Joseph M Johnson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misd Bail Jumping contrary to Wis Stat. 946.49(1)(a).  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 3 - DRI. Statement by DE. Court orders: 6 mos WCJ as to each count concurrent to one another, consecutive to any sentence currently being served at the time of the revocation - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Groh requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Case called @ 4:00 p.m. Defendant Joseph M Johnson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered as to all counts. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant, Search Warrant Return - red 1998 Ford Escort SE station wagon having Wisconsin Plate 859WXT and VIN 3FAFP15P6WR192105

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:14 p.m. Defendant Joseph M Johnson in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
